title: Which font in this used in the logo ?
content:
Hi

Hope someone can identify the font used.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [210px-Smiths\_Group\_svg.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824125845/http:/typophile.com/files/210px-Smiths_Group_svg_0.png) | 2.81 KB |
author: Ravn

comments.content: Reminds me of [RBNo3.1](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824125845/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rene-bieder/rbno3-1) mainly because of /s. May be a customization of it (no so hard to redo from it actually).

Thanks Ryuk for the suggestions, but it is not the right on.  
Please have a look at the compleate logo

[www.smiths-medical.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824125845/http:/www.smiths-medical.com/ "www.smiths-medical.com")

interesting. they use DIN in multiple weights but refer to "master artwork" for all logos and division logos, without any font spec.

googling "smiths medical font" should result in a pdf for their corp guidelines 2nd from top.
Sorry but what dos " DIN in Multiple weights" mean?

the font DIN  
bold, light, medium, etc
